result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sencere Lamont McDowell

Defendant Sencere Lamont McDowell in court.  Attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos Jr in court for Sencere Lamont McDowell.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders case dismissed but read-in to 22CM535 for sentencing purposes.

Defendant Sencere Lamont McDowell in court with attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sencere Lamont McDowell appeared by video means with Attorney.

Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.

Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Sencere Lamont McDowell in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Sencere Lamont McDowell in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sencere Lamont McDowell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
